result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J Eckert

records.addlTxt: WCS notifying Court that defendant has started SCRAM bracelet received and filed.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on October 24, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B (EXCEPTION: 3rd party contact for the sole purpose of an insurance claim) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS. CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

2:37 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Kyle J Eckert in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Kyle J Eckert. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
